title: Was the American Revolution planned or did it start suddenly? - Quora

History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Personally I think it was rather cheeky to ask for such things merely a few ticks of the clock after we had just won the seven years war for the good of the colonies. The natives and French had a rather gruesome end in waiting and we wiped it all better like a sore knee. Then you start demanding things. Rather cheeky and I think people forget that. Started it all. Fought to defend it. Lost it to the very people we did all that for….our own blood. The second British civil war.

It started suddenly by the “shot heard around the world”. On April 19, 1775, minutemen and militia faced off with British regulars at the North Bridge in Concord, Massachusetts. Someone, nobody knows on which side, opened fire, without orders.
